title: War in Ukraine: 'It's only possible to talk to the Russians from a position of strength'
summary: Oleksandr Lytvynenko has been secretary of Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council since March. In an interview with Le Monde, he describes the Kursk offensive as a 'significant success,' but acknowledges that 'it does not change the situation.'

title: Algeria re-elects President Tebboune in landslide victory
summary: Tebboune's win Sunday was still "a victory" although he failed to win the vote of young people, who represent half of Algeria's 45-million-strong population, analysts said.

title: After the invisible man, the (partially) transparent mouse
summary: On September 5, a research team from the United States revealed in the journal Science that it had achieved a groundbreaking advance in biomedical imaging. By applying a yellow dye known as tartrazine directly to the skin of rodents, the team succeeded in visualizing internal structures with unprecedented clarity.

summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the actress says she shares the message of her feature film, directed with Israeli filmmaker Guy Nattiv and inspired by true events.

title: Want more days off? Take the train!
summary: Pioneering French companies are introducing a new form of leave called "responsible travel time," granting employees one or two extra days off to accommodate slower, more eco-friendly transportation methods. An innovative initiative that is gaining traction.

title: 'The Monk and the Gun': Behind an idealized Bhutan, a Chinese anti-democracy production
summary: From the tiny Himalayan kingdom, 'The Monk and the Gun' has won over summer audiences with its apparent candor. In an article for 'Le Monde,' sinologist Marie Holzman sees it as a denigration of any electoral system, financed by Beijing's 'red elite.'

title: Israel airstrikes in central Syria, at least 7 dead
summary: Israeli airstrikes late Sunday, September 8, on Syria's Masyaf region killed seven people, including three civilians, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported. The strikes, which destroyed military facilities, also injured at least 15 others, according to the Britain-based monitor with sources in Syria.

summary: No. 1-ranked Sinner, a 23-year-old from Italy, won the second Grand Slam trophy of his nascent career – the other was at the Australian Open in January – and prevented No. 12 Fritz from ending a major title drought for American men that has lasted 21 years.
